Yes, the federal Liberal government has finally made the citizens of Alberta mad enough to actually want to leave Canada for good. articles.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
articles.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

articles.title: It’s “Valley or Bust” for Canada’s young entrepreneurs
articles.description: Colare’s Nain Abdi explains why his generation sees the Valley as their “launchpad.” The post It’s “Valley or Bust” for Canada’s young entrepreneurs first appeared on BetaKit.

articles.title: Canada, G7 security ministers pledge to fight organized crime together
articles.description: The ministers said transnational criminal organizations are "ruthless in their pursuit of profit, power and influence" through corruption, violence and other illicit means.

articles.title: Carney says ‘constructive’ talks ongoing with Alberta about oil pipeline
articles.description: Prime Minister Mark Carney on Sunday addressed speculation about whether an agreement is close for a new pipeline between Alberta and B.C.'s northern coast.

articles.title: GUEST OPINION: Why blanket upzoning won’t deliver the affordability Calgary needs
articles.description: Calgary is in a housing crunch, and two commentators from the Fraser Institute recently argued in these pages that blanket upzoning is essential to making new homes “faster and cheaper.” It’s a tidy theory. articles.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
articles.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

articles.title: Carney says U.S. peace plan for Ukraine needs ‘more work’; expert calls it a ‘disaster’
articles.description: Ukraine peace talks take centre stage at the G20 Summit in Johannesburg, with the United States, Russia and China notably absent from the summit.

articles.title: This glowing particle in a laser trap may reveal how lightning begins
articles.description: Using a precisely aligned pair of laser beams, scientists can now hold a single aerosol particle in place and monitor how it charges up. The particle’s glow signals each step in its changing electrical state, revealing how electrons are kicked away and how the particle sometimes releases sudden burs

articles.title: B.C. money launderer sentenced to 18 months in jail
articles.description: Alexandra Joie Chow, 37, was handed the sentenced in Richmond provincial court on Monday morning

articles.title: Woman dead after car and tractor-trailer collide in South Dundas Township
articles.description: Officers from the Stormont, Dundas and Glengarry OPP detachment responded to the collision just before 3:30 p.m. Friday

articles.title: This tiny plant survived the vacuum of space and still grows
articles.description: Moss spores survived an extended stay on the outside of the ISS and remained capable of germinating once back on Earth. articles.description: The short-term rental company folded earlier this month

articles.title: Man found dead in 'suspicious circumstances' at Edmonton house
articles.description: Edmonton police are investigating the suspicious death of a man found in a northwest Edmonton house Sunday night. articles.title: PMO and CBSA say they weren’t part of Kneecap entry ban announcement
articles.description: The Prime Minister's Office and the Canada Border Services Agency say they weren't 'involved' or 'consulted' in an announcement of an apparent entry ban on the Irish group Kneecap.

articles.title: Altman describes OpenAI’s forthcoming AI device as more peaceful and calm than the iPhone
articles.description: Altman and Ive tease a simple AI device aimed at calm, distraction-free computing, launching within two years.
